title: Instructional Design for Innovating Chemistry Education Using Computational Chemistry

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemistry theory and laboratory skills, basic ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: Computational chemistry training program for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields. Requires modular design enabling real-time lectures and collaborative learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Develop the ability to simulate chemical reactions using molecular modeling software and interpret results.
Cultivate the skill to analyze computational chemistry data with visualization tools and compare it with experimental outcomes.

In an online assessment system (LMS, Google Classroom, etc.), learners can select ≥three self-directed learning strategies (e.g., weekly study planner, feedback reflection journal, peer assessment), apply them for two weeks, and achieve ≥4 points (5-point scale) in a learning efficiency survey.

resources: Server Resources for Educational Data Analysis
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
